Hesperomimus Cameron, 1937: 17
(species included:
abdominalis
; [ Note: For the generic description Cameron spelled the name
Hesperominus
and for the species,
Hesperomimus
. Blackwelder, 1952: 183, argued that
Hesperomimus
is the correct spelling]).
TYPE SPECIES:
Hesperomimus abdominalis Cameron
, fixed by monotypy.

abdominalis Cameron, 1937: 17
(
Hesperomimus
; Type locality: Java : Batoerraden, G . Slamat).

(species included:
venustus
).
TYPE SPECIES:
Hesperopalpus venustus Shibata
, fixed by original designation and monotypy.
— Shibata, 1986a: 124 (supplemental list of species from Taiwan) .

— Schillhammer, 1999c: 303 (synopsis of genus; additional characters; notes; key to species).

(

; Type locality: Nilgiri Hills).

venustus Shibata, 1973: 25

Hesperus Fauvel, 1874: 200
[= 1874a: 426] (species included:
rufipennis
,
baltimorensis
,
apicialis
[cited as
apicalis
]).
TYPE SPECIES:
Staphylinus rufipennis Gravenhorst
, fixed by subsequent designation by R. Lucas, 1920: 324.
— Heyden, Reitter, and Weise, 1891: 102 (list of species of Europe and Caucasus).
— Heyden, Reitter, and Weise, 1906: 163 (list of species of Europe and Caucasus).
— Cameron, 1921a: 354, 405 (characters; key to Singapore species; catalog).
— Gridelli, 1924 (characters; anatomy; revision of species; key to species).
— Scheerpeltz, 1936a: 488 (key to Nearctic and Neotropical species).
— Blackwelder, 1944: 138 (checklist of species from Mexico , Central and South America, and
— Moore, 1958 (characters; notes; key to North American species).

Hesperotropis Gridelli
, 1924: 196 (subgenus of
Hesperus
; species included:
perfoliatus
; [ Note: Following the description of the subgenus
Hesperotropis Gridelli
described
Hesperus perfoliatus
and that species was followed by
Hesperus borneensis
,
H . bakeri
,
H . modestus
,
H . moultoni
,
H . ornatus
,
H . phaenomenalis
,
H . semicoeruleus
, and
H . terminalis
but it is unclear that Gridelli intended them to be assigned to the new subgenus. In his key to species (page 182) Gridelli did not group
H . perfoliatus
in any special way with the other species and Scheerpeltz, 1933: 1371 and 1971: 193 included only
H . perfoliatus
in the subgenus]).
TYPE SPECIES:
Hesperus ( Hesperotropis ) perfoliatus Gridelli
, fixed by monotypy [ Note: If only one species was originally included then the type species is fixed by monotypy; if the other eight species were included then Blackwelder, 1952: 184, fixed the type species by subsequent designation]. — Cameron, 1932: 156 (subgenus of
Hesperus
). — Scheerpeltz, 1933: 1371 (subgenus of
Hesperus
). — Blackwelder, 1952: 184 ( type species). — Scheerpeltz, 1971: 193 (subgenus of
Hesperus
; characters).
